title: GOP Sees Georgia Senate Races as ‘Firewall’ After Trump’s Loss
sub_head: With president’s role uncertain, McConnell directs colleagues to aid effort to keep Senate in Republican hands
body:
WASHINGTON—With President Trump’s drive to remain in office hitting a dead end, Senate Republicans are redoubling their efforts in Georgia, where a pair of runoffs will determine which party controls the Senate.
Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R., Ky.) and Sen. Todd Young (R., Ind.), the departing chairman of the National Republican Senatorial Committee, have told colleagues that each of them needs to help Sens. David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler keep their seats in the Jan. 5 races, GOP aides said. Senators are traveling...
